subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0063_01C9E033.97CDA340
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I think the bottom line is we all know that Chris Moon is probably just try=
ing to use you. He'll suck you dry and toss you aside when he gets his fill=
.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Fransen, Debbie 
  To: EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, May 29, 2009 7:45 AM
  Subject: RE: [EVP-IT=
C] Different chip config.






  Exactly my point... You don't charge anyt=
hing for the boxes
  and Chris Moon charges people for using it....
  If it=
's not perfected then Chris shouldn't charge either......
  If he wasn't so=
 public with it, then people like me wouldn't dislike him so much.

  The o=
nly people that have your boxes (that the public hear about)
  are the well=
 known paranormal groups and famous people.
  I am sure that you have given=
 boxes to researchers who are not in the popular
  paranormal community ,an=
d don't want to be. Those are the ones that should
  get respect.  And of c=
ourse YOU are well respected by us lowly researchers. ( Kissin up , so you =
won't get mad)

  And I am sure that you are sick of hearing about Chris Mo=
on and how
  alot of people thinks he sucks. And everyone wants a box......=

  But you have to expect that. You are the only one out there that is hone=
st and
  doesn't want to be famous.
  I know this is like beating a dead ho=
rse, so I will shut up now.... :)





------------------------------------=
------------------------------------------
  From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com =
[mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Frank Sumption
  Sent: Friday=
, May 29, 2009 9:22 AM
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: Re: [EVP-IT=
C] Different chip config.



   Keep in mind the money thing works two ways=
, I also don't sell/charge for the boxes. Someday I will--when it's perfect=
ed!

   Frank-S


  On Fri, May 29, 2009 at 6:16 AM, Fransen, Debbie <debbi=
e.fransen@...> wrote:





    Of course Chris Moon speaks highly of =
him.
    Frank has made him lots of money.



-----------------------------=
-----------------------------------------------
    From: EVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
ps.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Elaine Coates
    Sent=
: Thursday, May 28, 2009 3:49 PM 

    To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com

    Sub=
ject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.




    Okay, then could I have =
a copy of the new schematic when you get it drawn?  That would be even bett=
er.  Where are you from?  Chris Moon speaks highly of you.




------------=
----------------------------------------------------------------
    From: =
Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>
    To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
=
    Sent: Thursday, May 28, 2009 2:29:09 PM
    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Diff=
erent chip config.


    Besides--I didn't like that radio design, it's too=
 complex, and the documentation is screwy. I did a simpler radio last night=
 that should be better, simpler, cheaper, and clearer sound. 



    On Thu=
, May 28, 2009 at 5:41 AM, Elaine Coates <cozykat2003@ yahoo.com> wrote:


=



      The jpg for this schematic is kind of blurry in places.  Is there =
any way a more clear copy could be send to me? I would be forever grateful.=
  Thanks Frank - Elaine




-----------------------------------------------=
---------------------------
      From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gm=
ail.com>

      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
      Sent: Thursday, May 28, =
2009 12:55:00 AM
      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.



   =
   http://purplealieng irl.tripod. com/ 

       However, it's constantly c=
hanging. The radio I made tonight is very simple, and can significantly sim=
plify construction. I used to make the sweep and amplifier circuits, then u=
se a commercial radio, like the 12-469, as a tuner. 

       The MK484 is f=
ollwed by a couple high impedence op amp stages to bring the audio up to li=
ne levels. I haven't had time to do schematic yet. I draw the schematics wi=
th MS paint, and they are stored as jpeg images, which isn't the best, but =
it makes them e-mailable. 

       Frank-S


      On Wed, May 27, 2009 at =
8:54 PM, Elaine Coates <cozykat2003@ yahoo.com> wrote:





        Hi folk=
s, I just joined this group.  I was recently at the Lizzy Borden house in M=
assachusetts with Chris Moon and had a session with Frank's Box.  The resul=
ts were astounding.  Is this the newest schematic for Frank's box?  If so, =
is there a way to get a clearer copy of it?  My son said he would build one=
 for me and I have been searching for the schematic.  Can anyone help? - El=
aine




------------------------------------------------------------------=
------
        From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com>

        T=
o: evp-itc@yahoogroups .com; grassharp@yahoogrou ps.com 

        Sent: Wed=
nesday, May 27, 2009 5:45:16 PM
        Subject: [EVP-ITC] Different chip c=
onfig. [1 Attachment]




         I think I followed an erroneous LM3820 l=
ayout, so I'm going to breadboard this layout. Note the antenna input is no=
w on pin 12-11, this is the RF amp input, and pin 13 is the RF amp output, =
which feeds pin 1.

         'case anyone cares. 

         F-S











=
